  • Constructor Details

    • ClusReliefFeatureRanking

      public ClusReliefFeatureRanking(RowData data, int[] neighbours, int[] iterations, boolean weightNeighbours, double sigma, int seed, Settings sett, SettingsRelief.MissingTargetHandling missingTargetHandling, double[] sslWinterval, ClusRun cr)
      Constructor for the ClusReliefFeatureRanking, with the standard parameters of (R)Relief(F).
      Parameters:
      neighbours - The number of neighbours that is used in the feature importance calculation. Constraints:

      0 < neighbours <= number of instances in the dataset

      iterations - The number of iterations in the feature importance calculation. Constraints:

      0 < iterations <= number of instances in the dataset

      weightNeighbours - If weightNeighbours, then the contribution of the i-th nearest neighbour in the feature importance calculation are weighted with factor exp((- sigma * i) ** 2).
      sigma - The rate of quadratic exponential decay. Note that Weka's sigma is the inverse of our sigma.

    • computeDistance

      public double computeDistance(DataTuple t1, DataTuple t2, int space) throws ClusException
      Distance between tuples in the subspace space.
      Parameters:
      t1 - The first tuple
      t2 - The second tuple
      space - 0 or 1; if 0, subspace is descriptive space and target space otherwise.
      Returns:
      Distance between t1 and t2 in the given subspace.
      Throws:
      ClusException

    • computeDistance1D

      public double computeDistance1D(DataTuple t1, DataTuple t2, ClusAttrType attr) throws ClusException
      Calculates the distance between to tuples in a given component attr.
      Parameters:
      t1 - The first tuple
      t2 - The second tuple
      attr - The attribute/dimension in which the distance between t1 and t2 is computed.
      Returns:
      distance(attr.value(t1), attr.value(t2))
      Throws:
      ClusException

    • computeNominalDist1D

      public double computeNominalDist1D(DataTuple t1, DataTuple t2, NominalAttrType attr)
      Calculates distance between the nominal values of the component attr. In the case of missing values, we follow Weka's solution and not the paper Theoretical and Empirical Analysis of ReliefF and RReliefF, by Robnik Sikonja and Kononenko (time complexity ...).
      Parameters:
      t1 - The first tuple
      t2 - The second tuple
      attr - The nominal attribute/dimension in which the distance between t1 and t2 is computed.
      Returns:
      distance(attr.value(t1), attr.value(t2))

    • computeNumericDist1D

      public double computeNumericDist1D(DataTuple t1, DataTuple t2, NumericAttrType attr, double normalizationFactor)
      Calculates distance between the numeric values of the component attr. In the case of missing values, we follow Weka's solution and not the paper Theoretical and Empirical Analysis of ReliefF and RReliefF, by Robnik Sikonja and Kononenko (time complexity ...).
      Parameters:
      t1 - The first tuple
      t2 - The second tuple
      attr - The numeric attribute/dimension in which the distance between t1 and t2 is computed.
      normalizationFactor - Typically,

      normalizationFactor = 1 / (m_numMaxs[attr.name()] - m_numMins[attr.name()]).

      Returns:
      If v1 and v2 are the numeric values of the attribute attr for the instances t1 and t2, the value

      |v1 - v2| / normalizationFactor

      is returned.

    • computeHierarchicalDist1D

      Parameters:
      t1 - The first tuple
      t2 - The second tuple

    • computeStringDist1D

      Computes Levenshtein's distance between the string values of the component attr.
      Parameters:
      t1 - The first tuple
      t2 - The second tuple
      attr - The string attribute/dimension in which the distance between t1 and t2 is computed.
      Returns:
      Levenshtein distance between attr.value(t1) and attr.value(t2).
